definition: to wind/to coil (thread)/to rotate around/to spiral/to move around/to go round (an obstacle)/to by-pass/to make a detour/to confuse/to perplex
"silk" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 120), occurring in 红, 绿, 累 etc/also pr. [mi4]
surname Yao/Yao or Tang Yao (c. 2200 BC), one of Five legendary Emperors 五帝[wu3 di4], second son of Di Ku 帝嚳|帝喾[Di4 Ku4]
to revolve around/to center on (an issue)
to go by a roundabout route/to take a detour/(medicine or civil engineering) bypass
to make a detour/to take the long route
reverberates around the rafters (idiom); fig. sonorous and resounding (esp. of singing voice)
to go around in circles/to make a detour/(fig.) to beat about the bush
lit. to go on a long detour/fig. to speak vaguely around the topic without getting to the point/to beat about the bush
to go for a walk around/fig. to speak in a roundabout way

sentences.english: I followed this kitty all around the places, and finally got this lovely shot.
sentences.chinese: 我追著它繞來繞去，最後終於等到這張可愛的照片。

sentences.english: I followed this kitty all around the places, and finally got this lovely shot.
sentences.chinese: 我追著它繞來繞去，最後終於等到這張可愛的照片。

sentences.english: An actor circling the stage suggests a long journey.
sentences.chinese: 而演員繞臺奔走則代表長途跋涉。

sentences.english: Their first exhibition of themselves was in a processional march of two and two round the parish.
sentences.chinese: 他們最初的表演是排成雙行隊伍繞着教區遊行。

sentences.english: Do you want to run around the park just for the holl of it ?
sentences.chinese: 那你想要繞着公園跑僅僅是爲了好玩？

sentences.english: Dozens of bees circled his tousled brown curls in an angle's halo.
sentences.chinese: 一羣蜜蜂繞着他那蓬亂的棕色捲髮，好像天使的光環。

sentences.english: My sister likes to go sight-seeing in a pleasure boat around the West Lake.
sentences.chinese: 妹妹喜歡坐遊舫繞着西湖觀光遊玩。

sentences.english: The act of turning or winding or folding around a central axis .
sentences.chinese: 圍繞一箇中心軸翻或繞或疊的動作。

sentences.english: Then they returned to the orbiting command module and started back to earth.
sentences.chinese: 然後，他們返回繞月軌道上的指令艙，開始返回地球。

sentences.english: The iron was magnetized by passing electricity through wire wound round it.
sentences.chinese: 這塊鐵因繞在上面的線圈通了電而有磁性。

sentences.english: The two hunters wheel around and ride into the woods along a game trail.
sentences.chinese: 着兩個獵人騎着馬繞了幾圈然後相互追逐着奔進叢林。

sentences.english: The Princes Highway skirts the rim of the Illawa Plateau.
sentences.chinese: 公路繞着依拉瓦高原的邊緣走。

sentences.english: To save it, plans have been drawn to build a massive wall around the base of the pagoda.
sentences.chinese: 爲了搶救石寶寨，他們打算繞着塔基修築巨大圍堤。

sentences.english: The teacher said that the moon goes around the earth yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 老師昨兲說月亮繞着哋球囀。

sentences.english: What are those dogs doing sniffing at my feet?
sentences.chinese: 這些在我腳邊繞來繞去的狗，在聞些什麼呀？

sentences.english: What are those dogs doing sniffing at my feet?
sentences.chinese: 這些在我腳邊繞來繞去的狗，在聞些什麼呀？

definition: to detour/to bypass/to circumvent/to avoid/to wind around (of a road etc)
to wind around/to wrap round/to coil/tangle/to involve/to bother/to annoy
to encircle/to surround/all around/to wear by wrapping around (scarf, shawl)
to bend/bent/a bend/a turn (in the road etc)/CL:道[dao4]
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)
to rotate (about an axis)/to revolve/to turn/to move in a circle/to gyrate
to expel/to urge on/to drive/to run quickly
to spiral/to circle/to go around/to hover/to orbit
